alert.note: Alert for Mills (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 11:17PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN MILLS...SARPY... NORTHEASTERN LANCASTER AND CASS COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 PM CDT... At 1116 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Prairie Queen Recreation Area to near Louisville to 3 miles north of Eagle. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bellevue, Papillion, Offutt AFB, La Vista, Plattsmouth, Springfield, Louisville, Weeping Water, Elmwood, Murray, Cedar Creek, Murdock, Chalco, Prairie Queen Recreation Area, Walnut Creek Recreation Area, Wehrspann Lake, Beaver Lake, Manley, Alvo, and South Bend. People attending Sarpy County Fairgrounds should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 near mile marker 42. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 435 and 444. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
